customConfig.name: magicNumber
customConfig.label: Magic number (layout spacing)
customConfig.note: This value is used across multiple layout elements - including section paddings, wrapper spacing, grid gutters, and content insets. It serves as a unified spacing baseline. The default value 'clamp(1rem, 4vw, 6rem)' ensures responsive spacing that adapts to different screen sizes while maintaining visual harmony. When set equal to the Page margin, it reinforces a cohesive and consistent layout throughout the theme.

customConfig.name: pageWidth
customConfig.label: Page width
customConfig.note: Defines the overall width of the page. This should always be greater than or equal to the Entry width to ensure proper layout. Set to 100% for full-screen width.

customConfig.name: entryWidth
customConfig.label: Entry width
customConfig.note: Defines the width of content for posts and pages. Ensure that this value is smaller than or equal to the Page width for proper content display.

customConfig.name: borderRadius
customConfig.label: Corner roundness
customConfig.note: Adjust the roundness of corners for elements like images, buttons or dropdown menus. Increasing this value (in pixels) will make the corners more rounded.

customConfig.name: baseline
customConfig.label: Baseline
customConfig.note: Defines a core vertical rhythm unit for consistent spacing across the website, used as a multiplier for margins and paddings. Increasing this value enhances spacing, creating an airier layout, while decreasing it compacts content, for tighter visual appeal.

customConfig.name: imagePlaceholder
customConfig.label: Image placeholder
customConfig.note: When enabled, a light background color is applied to elements such as featured or gallery images. This helps maintain a consistent layout while images are loading or unavailable. It does not affect images within the content of posts or pages.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Branding Banner
customConfig.note: This option allows you to display a custom Branding Banner at the top of the page. You can upload an image (preferably in SVG format for better scalability) and adjust its maximum height.

customConfig.name: hideBrandingBannerOnMobile
customConfig.label: Hide on mobile
customConfig.note: Hide the branding banner on mobile devices if it takes up too much vertical space; it will remain visible on desktops.

customConfig.name: uploadBrandingBanner
customConfig.label: Image
customConfig.note: If you don't have an SVG file, you can generate one from text using an external tool like Text to SVG. If you want your SVG to support dark mode, refer to the tips in the Publii documentation.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Posts and Pages
customConfig.note: The Featured Image settings do not apply to the 'Divided Header' templates, as this template's layout is controlled by the Hero section settings due to their similar structure. Related Posts are available only for posts, not pages, due to their distinct nature.

customConfig.name: contentAspectRatioMobile
customConfig.label: Featured image aspect ratio for mobile

customConfig.name: contentAspectRatioTablet
customConfig.label: Featured image aspect ratio for tablet

customConfig.name: contentAspectRatioDesktop
customConfig.label: Featured image aspect ratio for desktop

customConfig.name: contentObjectFit
customConfig.label: Featured image fit
customConfig.note: Defines how the featured image should be resized to fit its container. 'Cover' ensures the image covers the entire area, while maintaining its aspect ratio. Other options allow more control over how the image fits.

customConfig.name: relatedPostsNumber
customConfig.label: Related post
customConfig.note: Specify number of related posts to show. Zero '0' means no posts.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Custom blog index page
customConfig.note: This setting will apply to the custom blog index page only when you activate a post prefix in Site Settings -> SEO (e.g., '/blog/').

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note:
Given the extensive number of configurable options, the Homepage settings are organized into five dedicated sections to enhance clarity and usability. You can easily navigate to each section using the tabs on the left side.

Since the homepage is not a typical blog page, we recommend disabling homepage pagination for better SEO. You can do this by navigating to Site Settings → SEO → Homepage Section and disabling the pagination option.

customConfig.name: sectionTitleWidth
customConfig.label: Section title width
customConfig.note: Specify the width for section titles. Use units like 'ch', 'px', '%', etc.

customConfig.name: sectionHero
customConfig.note: Please note: that the hero section is intentionally designed around images. If no images are provided, the section will not appear as intended and may disrupt the overall design.

customConfig.name: uploadHeroAlt
customConfig.label: Image Alt text
customConfig.placeholder: Add an alternative text to the hero image

customConfig.name: uploadHeroCaption
customConfig.label: Image Caption
customConfig.placeholder: Add a caption to be displayed under the hero image

customConfig.name: textHero
customConfig.label: Main content
customConfig.value:
Nordic Wall

Scandinavian Elegance. Timeless Design

Transform your interiors with NordicWall, a premium wooden slatted wall that combines natural beauty with modern functionality. Inspired by minimalism and a refined aesthetic to any space.

customConfig.name: buttonHeroLinkName
customConfig.placeholder: Provide the text for the button

customConfig.name: featuredPostsNumber
customConfig.label: Number of posts
customConfig.note: Note: To display all featured posts, set the value to -1.

customConfig.name: heroTagsAmount
customConfig.label: Number of posts
customConfig.note: Note: To display all posts, set the value to -1.

customConfig.name: heroTagsExcluded
customConfig.label: Exclude posts
customConfig.note: Enter a post ID, or IDs separated by comma

translations.emptyState: Click the button below to add a new slide

customConfig.name: heroContentWidth
customConfig.label: Text content width
customConfig.note: Defines the width of the text area in the Hero section. You can use any valid CSS units such as 'ch', 'rem', or 'px'. The background and filter effects of this block can be customized in the Tiles section.

customConfig.name: heroTitleSize
customConfig.label: Title size
customConfig.note: This option allows you to adjust the title size. If the title is too long, a large font size may negatively impact the layout.

customConfig.name: heroImageObjectFit
customConfig.label: Image Fit
customConfig.note: Defines how the hero image should be resized to fit its container. 'Cover' ensures the image covers the entire area, while maintaining its aspect ratio. Other options allow more control over how the image fits.

customConfig.name: heroSliderFade
customConfig.label: Fade mode
customConfig.note: Enable fade mode. If disabled, the slider will use the default carousel mode.

customConfig.name: heroSliderFadeDuration
customConfig.label: Fade duration
customConfig.note: Fade transition duration in seconds

customConfig.name: heroSliderDuration
customConfig.label: Slide transition duration
customConfig.note: Adjust the duration of slide transitions. Higher values result in slower transitions. Note: Duration is not in milliseconds, as the slider script uses an attraction-based physics simulation for scrolling instead of traditional easing functions.

customConfig.name: heroSliderDragFree
customConfig.label: Drag free mode
customConfig.note: Allows free dragging of slides without snapping to a specific slide.

customConfig.name: heroSliderParallax
customConfig.label: Parallax effect
customConfig.note: The parallax effect involves images moving at different speeds, creating a sense of depth where images appear to slide over or under each other.

customConfig.name: heroSliderParallaxFactor
customConfig.label: Parallax factor
customConfig.note: Adjust the intensity of the parallax effect

customConfig.name: heroSliderLoop
customConfig.label: Loop
customConfig.note: Moves throughout all the slides seamlessly

customConfig.name: heroSliderAutoplayInterval
customConfig.label: Autoplay interval
customConfig.note: Time in milliseconds between auto slides (1000ms = 1s)

customConfig.name: heroSliderAutoplayStopOnInteraction
customConfig.label: Stop on Interaction
customConfig.note: Whether autoplay should stop after user interacts with the slider.

customConfig.name: heroSliderAutoplayStopOnMouseEnter
customConfig.label: Stop on Mouse Enter
customConfig.note: Whether autoplay should stop when the mouse enters the slider area.

customConfig.name: heroSliderWheelGestures
customConfig.label: Wheel Gestures
customConfig.note: Enable users to navigate the slider using mouse or trackpad wheel gestures. This improves navigation experience, especially for desktop users.

customConfig.name: heroSliderWheelForceAxis
customConfig.label: Force Wheel Axis
customConfig.note: Choose the direction of wheel gestures. X-axis scrolls horizontally, Y-axis scrolls vertically.

customConfig.name: heroSliderUseClassNames
customConfig.label: Slide CSS class names
customConfig.note: Primarily for developers, this feature adds specific class names to each slide for easier custom styling (e.g., is-snapped, is-in-view, is-draggable, is-dragging, is-loop).

customConfig.name: featuresSectionTitle
customConfig.label: Section title
customConfig.value: NordicWall transforms interiors with warmth and modern elegance

customConfig.name: featuresSectionIntroGrid
customConfig.label: Grid layout
customConfig.note: Please note that each item in the field below ('Intro content') is treated as a separate column. If you select the two-column layout and want to group multiple elements in one column, wrap them inside a container like this: <div>Your elements here</div>.

customConfig.name: featuresTagsAmount
customConfig.label: Number of posts
customConfig.note: Note: To display all posts, set the value to -1.

customConfig.name: featuresTagsExcluded
customConfig.label: Exclude posts
customConfig.note: Enter a post ID, or IDs separated by comma

customConfig.name: features2SectionIntroGrid
customConfig.label: Grid layout
customConfig.note: Please note that each item in the field below ('Intro content') is treated as a separate column. If you select the two-column layout and want to group multiple elements in one column, wrap them inside a container like this: <div>Your elements here</div>.

customConfig.name: features2TagsAmount
customConfig.label: Number of posts
customConfig.note: Note: To display all posts, set the value to -1.

customConfig.name: features2TagsExcluded
customConfig.label: Exclude posts
customConfig.note: Enter a post ID, or IDs separated by comma

structure.name: metricDescription
structure.label: Metric Description
structure.placeholder: e.g. Transforming spaces with wooden slatted walls

customConfig.name: insightsTagsAmount
customConfig.label: Number of posts
customConfig.note: Note: To display all posts, set the value to -1.

customConfig.name: insightsTagsExcluded
customConfig.label: Exclude posts
customConfig.note: Enter a post ID, or IDs separated by comma

customConfig.name: insightsSliderDuration
customConfig.label: Slide transition duration
customConfig.note: Adjust the duration of slide transitions. Higher values result in slower transitions. Note: Duration is not in milliseconds, as the slider script uses an attraction-based physics simulation for scrolling instead of traditional easing functions.

customConfig.name: insightsSliderDragFree
customConfig.label: Drag free mode
customConfig.note: Allows free dragging of slides without snapping to a specific slide.

customConfig.name: insightsSliderLoop
customConfig.label: Loop
customConfig.note: Moves throughout all the slides seamlessly

customConfig.name: insightsSliderAutoplayInterval
customConfig.label: Autoplay interval
customConfig.note: Time in milliseconds between auto slides (1000ms = 1s)

customConfig.name: insightsSliderAutoplayStopOnInteraction
customConfig.label: Stop on Interaction
customConfig.note: Whether autoplay should stop after user interacts with the slider.

customConfig.name: insightsSliderAutoplayStopOnMouseEnter
customConfig.label: Stop on Mouse Enter
customConfig.note: Whether autoplay should stop when the mouse enters the slider area.

customConfig.name: insightsSliderWheelGestures
customConfig.label: Wheel Gestures
customConfig.note: Enable users to navigate the slider using mouse or trackpad wheel gestures. This improves navigation experience, especially for desktop users.

customConfig.name: insightsSliderWheelForceAxis
customConfig.label: Force Wheel Axis
customConfig.note: Choose the direction of wheel gestures. X-axis scrolls horizontally, Y-axis scrolls vertically.

customConfig.name: insightsSliderUseClassNames
customConfig.label: Slide CSS class names
customConfig.note: Primarily for developers, this feature adds specific class names to each slide for easier custom styling (e.g., is-snapped, is-in-view, is-draggable, is-dragging, is-loop).

customConfig.name: sectionFaqTitle
customConfig.label: Section title
customConfig.value: Find answers to the most common questions about NordicWall

translations.emptyState: Click the button below to add a new FAQ item.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note:
The Post list section provides global settings for controlling how posts are displayed across the website, including the homepage, tag pages, author listings, and others. You can choose between two display formats: Cards and Tiles.

Cards show posts as compact blocks with an image followed by text content below, while Tiles present posts in a more visual layout with large images and overlaid or stacked text blocks. Each layout type offers its own customization options in the sections below.

· Cards options
· Tiles options

customConfig.name: separatorCards
customConfig.note: Cards are used across post listing views such as the homepage, tags, authors, and related posts. They appear as compact blocks where the image is shown above, followed by the post title, and optionally the excerpt and the publication date. This section allows you to define the visual structure and display behavior of the card layout.

customConfig.name: cardsObjectFit
customConfig.label: Image fit
customConfig.note: Defines how the image should be resized to fit its container. 'Cover' ensures the image covers the entire area, while maintaining its aspect ratio. Other options allow more control over how the image fits.

customConfig.name: cardsExcerpt
customConfig.label: Show excerpt
customConfig.note: 'All post listings' shows the excerpt on all post loops, including tags, authors, and related posts. 'Only on blog index' displays excerpts only on the blog index page, if the 'Posts prefix' is set in the Site Settings → SEO. 'Nowhere' disables excerpts completely.

customConfig.name: separatorTiles
customConfig.note: Tiles are used to present posts and pages in a larger, visually impactful format. Each tile features a full-width image with overlaid text content, including the title, description, and an optional button. This layout is commonly used in homepage sections such as ‘Features’, as well as in alternative post and page templates referred to as ‘Project’. This section allows you to configure the layout, structure, and visibility of tile-based listings.

customConfig.name: tilesObjectFit
customConfig.label: Image fit
customConfig.note: Defines how the image should be resized to fit its container. 'Cover' ensures the image covers the entire area, while maintaining its aspect ratio. Other options allow more control over how the image fits.

customConfig.name: tilesBackdropBackground
customConfig.label: Text content background for light mode
customConfig.note: CSS color value for the text background inside a tile. Use an RGBA color or transparent.

customConfig.name: tilesBackdropDarkBackground
customConfig.label: Text content background for dark mode
customConfig.note: CSS color value for the text background inside a tile. Use an RGBA color or transparent.

customConfig.name: tilesBackdropFilter
customConfig.label: Text content backdrop filter
customConfig.note: CSS filter applied to the text background, e.g. blur, brightness, or opacity effects. Use a valid `backdrop-filter` value.

customConfig.name: submenuWidth
customConfig.note: The submenu width in PX unit

customConfig.name: navbarButtonLinkName
customConfig.label: Button Text
customConfig.placeholder: Provide the text for the button

customConfig.name: colorScheme
customConfig.label: Select color scheme
customConfig.note: The auto color scheme feature automatically adjusts the color scheme of the interface to match the user's operating system settings. If the operating system does not support this feature, the light version of the color scheme is used instead

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Main font settings
customConfig.note: To explore an extensive list of available fonts, along with detailed information about their typefaces, complete range of weights, and other specifications, please visit our documentation.

customConfig.name: disableFontBodyItalic
customConfig.label: Disable italic style
customConfig.note: This option allows you to disable the loading of the dedicated italic version for the body font. The italic font is automatically loaded when selecting a body font that supports it, like Lora, for optimal appearance. However, for performance reasons, you can choose to prevent loading the dedicated italic version by enabling this option.

customConfig.name: disableFontHeadingsItalic
customConfig.label: Disable italic style
customConfig.note: This option allows you to disable loading of the dedicated italic version for the headings font. The italic font is automatically loaded when selecting a headings font that supports it, like Lora, for optimal appearance. However, for performance reasons, you can choose to prevent loading of the dedicated italic version by enabling this option.

options.label: Select the font used for the Body
Select the font used for the Headings
Select the font used for the Body
Select the font used for the Headings

customConfig.name: minFontSize
customConfig.label: Minimum font size
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: maxFontSize
customConfig.label: Maximum font size
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: lineHeight
customConfig.label: Line height
customConfig.note: The default line-height for text within body elements, excluding headings.

customConfig.name: letterSpacing
customConfig.label: Letter spacing
customConfig.note: Adjusts the spacing between characters for body text elements, excluding headings, in EM.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: Note that not all fonts support the full range of weights; instead, they will typically support a standard range between 400 and 700. To see the exact range available for the selected body font, please visit our documentation.

customConfig.name: fontHeadingsLineHeight
customConfig.label: H1-H6 line height
customConfig.note: The default line-height for heading elements (h1, h2, h3, etc.).

customConfig.name: fontHeadingsletterSpacing
customConfig.label: H1-H6 letter spacing
customConfig.note: Adjusts the spacing between characters for heading elements (h1, h2, h3, etc.) in EM.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: This section allows you to choose your preferred share buttons for various platforms. If you wish to add more, you can install the Social Sharing plugin available on the Publii Marketplace.

customConfig.name: shareTwitterName
customConfig.note: Enter your X account's handle here; it will be used when the X share button is clicked on your site e.g. 'via @XHandle'. If left blank, the default username of @SiteName will be used

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: The Footer section consists of two main areas: the top and the bottom section. The top area contains up to three columns: a logo, a 'Contact Us' section, and a 'Call to Action' area. The bottom area includes the copyright, a menu (managed via the Menu Management system), and follow buttons.

customConfig.name: contactUsText
customConfig.label: Text
customConfig.value:
Research Park
21 Technology Drive
Mountain View, CA 94043

Hours
Monday to Friday
08:00 to 16:00 EST

customConfig.name: footerCTAText
customConfig.label: Text
customConfig.value:
Contact our team for a free consultation or explore our product range.

Let's Talk - It's Free!

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Company links
customConfig.note: This section is managed through the Menu Manager in Publii. You need to create a menu and assign it to the 'Footer Menu' position.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Follow buttons
customConfig.note: This section allows you to add follow buttons for various social media platforms. If you want to expand the available options, you can install the Follow Buttons plugin available on the Publii Marketplace.

customConfig.name: searchFeature
customConfig.label: Search
customConfig.note: Enable / disable the search box, which is usually located next to the top menu. In order to use the search function, you also need to install the search plugin.

customConfig.name: createSearchPage
customConfig.label: Search subpage
customConfig.note: Enabling this option will create an additional search.html page which may be required by some search plugins to display the search results on a separate page.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: To use the gallery functionality, you need to install the appropriate plugin. Please check the available gallery plugins in the Publii Marketplace.

customConfig.name: galleryItemGap
customConfig.label: Gallery item spacing
customConfig.note: You can use the --baseline variable and multiply it, but you can also use other values like px or rem.

options.label: Custom - create your own date format

customConfig.name: formatDateCustom
customConfig.label: Create a custom date format
customConfig.note: More details you can find here.

customConfig.name: lazyLoadEffect
customConfig.label: Lazy load effects
customConfig.note: This option works only if the 'Media lazy load' option is enabled in the Website Speed tab under Site Settings

customConfig.name: faviconUpload
customConfig.label: Upload favicon file
customConfig.note: The ideal size of a favicon is 16x16 pixels. Save your favicon as either favicon.png or favicon.ico

authorConfig.name: displayPostList
authorConfig.label: Display post list
authorConfig.note: Disabling the post list can cause duplicate content issues. To avoid this, please disable authors pagination in the SEO section of your site settings.

tagConfig.name: displayPostList
tagConfig.label: Display post list
tagConfig.note: Disabling the post list can cause duplicate content issues. To avoid this, please disable tag pagination in the SEO section of your site settings.
